results.title: Anatomy of an inflation
results.creator_credit: Philip S. Goodman, Charles N. Burnaford and Federal Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Inflation traditionally has resulted from excess demand pushing prices up when the economy is not operating at capacity. However, when the “production machine” is producing all that it can, increased demand cannot result in the production of more goods. Instead, the increased demand simply pushes prices up. As a result of viewing this film, students will be able to discuss what an inflation is, what its causes are, and how inflations can differ. They will also be able to understand the role of government with regard to business and the economy. Narrated by Edwin Newman. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Anatomy of a teenage marriage
results.brief_description: After five months of marriage, Dave and Vickie find that married life isn’t what they expected it to be. Suffering from boredom, frustration and problems of immaturity, they begin to realize that they must both make important changes to save their marriage. Second edition of “Marriage is a partnership”. No other credits available.

results.title: Anatomical models
results.brief_description: A study of the manufacture of anatomical models, and their use in demonstrating the position of various organs, bones and muscles in the body. Suitable for Upper Primary to Upper Secondary students. No other credits available.

results.title: Analysis by mass: an introduction to the mass spectrometer
results.creator_credit: Brian Kaufman, Michael Clarke and Associated Electrical Industries Film Unit
results.brief_description: Structure of atom and nucleus; definition of isotopes; principle of the mass spectograph, explained by a model in which balls of different masses are deflected by different amounts in a constant magnetic field. Construction of a mass spectrometer. Uses of mass spectrometry: to identify molecules, determine molecular structure, measure impurities, analyse gases in breath, radioactive dating of rocks.

results.title: The Middle Ages
results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
History of the Middle Ages from Charlemagne examined through art, monasteries, agriculture and invasions. Illustrated by 15th century miniatures, the film gives a good background to European history, literature and art.

results.title: The Romans
results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Presents the origins, growth and collapse of the Roman Empire. Describes how the Romans imitated the greek ideal of the city state and how they expanded over a period of 400 years, emerging as the ruling force of the world. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
A survey of the impact of the French Revolution from 1789, through the 1838, 1848 revolutions to the Paris Commune of 1871.

results.title: An Age of Revolutions. Great Britain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Revolution, nationalism, liberty, war, and industrialisation, were the main themes in the history of Europe from 1789 to 1870. This looks at the effects of the two main revolutions in this time, on the whole of Europe. The French Revolution brought new ideas and politics, and the Industrial Revolution brought new wealth and motives, and an urban industrialised society

results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Explains and illustrates the transition from the Middle Ages to the Renaissance, including the principles of the new study and attitudes in art, architecture and scholarship

results.title: Myths of nationalism
results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Towards the end of the 19th century, there was, in Europe, a second wave of industrialisation with a more advanced technology. This considers each of the major powers within Europe in relation to this new technology, in the years leading up to the Great War of 1914-18.
